Reviews.Title: “good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bear55
Reviews.Content: Located just outside airport and in the Marriott campus thet includes a Marriott and Residence Inn. Rooms and lobby have been upgraded to new Courtyard style. Large baths and very large work out room. Nice point is hotel is connected to Marriott. I payed a corporate rate but regular rate is high ($200 range) for a Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: Cph4
Reviews.Content: Exactly what you would expect from a good courtyard. Service was outstanding. No com

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Willing to Help Business Travelers”
Reviews.Author: Kiana B
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff arranged for a personal shuttle to have cargo delivered at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “whatever!”
Reviews.Author: SylviesMama
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard product does not vary from property to property. It's the people, the management at each property that makes them live up to hospitality. Or not. The Courtyard Miami Airport South has a collection of what must be the snottiest brats in all of Florida. I do not understand why they work in hospitality. On a recent lay over at the airport, they did not follow up with a reservation change as they indicated they would via telephone before I left the Great Pacific Northwest; by the time I arrived in Florida, they sold my room but did not reserve me another as they claimed they would. No rooms! Not to worry. They got me a room at The Residence next door, for twice the rate! Even if it was their mistake! Not to worry. I know how to access the Marriott customer service center and I am confident, given the circumstances and my documentation, I will get all my money back. But this ragtag outfit of posers put me through a lot of angst and exasperation and cost me hours and hours of time I would have used prepping for my meeting or laying by the pool in the sun, Stay here only if you have an abundant excess of emotional energy to spare. And think indifferent, insolent people are cute.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaL1968
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here when we had a lay over prior to our cruise. The lousy service started when we waited for over an hour for a shuttle bus to get us and 5 other families while other hotel shuttles went by 5-6 times each. When we arrived the attendant was rude and unhelpful. We were given very little information regarding availability of the next days shuttle. When we got up and ready the next day...we came out to the continental breakfast at 9:55....the staff was already tearing down the breakfast (which closed at 10:00) and refused to let us have any breakfast even though there was still fruit etc on the counters. The breakfast is included in the cost of the room ($20 for 2 people) and we were upset we were refused service. We had to wait until after we arrived at the port and boarded our ship which wasn't until the afternoon to eat. The hotel is designed strangely in a weird shape so you have to walk a long way to get anywhere in the hotel. Pay the extra $$ and stay somewhere more customer friendly!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay near MIA”
Reviews.Author: WLG37
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard, though large, has an extremely friendly staff who really take an interest in their guests. The rooms are very pleasant, and there's a good fitness center and a large pool, shared with the adjacent Marriott. The food is the one uninspired touch, but there are some good, inexpensive restaurants within a five-minute walk. The airport shuttle service is first rate. The place is run by an amiable, experienced manager named Jerry, who is a credit to the organization.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tami B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my flight had issues so I drove to this Courtyard to catch another flight the next day. I only stayed one night but the front staff was very helpful. The room was clean and we brought our own food and used the microwave that was in the lobby. It did seem very busy but you could tell the front desk staff was trying their best to accomodate everyone. We have one toddler, so we shared a king size bed but if you were traveling with older or more kids, I would definitely choose a double queen, even though the couch folds out into a bed in the room we stayed in. It was close to the airport and very convenient and easy to get to. We had a rental car but they do offer complimentary shuttle to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stop over Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Loews
Reviews.Content: My Spouse and two children stayed overnight prior to boarding a cruise on December 30 2012. I have traveled to many Hotels for overnight stays near the airport and this visit was very good. Its a big complex of Marriott Hotels - we arrived around 1am from a delayed flight, staff were very nice and helpful and the rooms were above average for what you pay. We had two double and the beds were very comfortable. Washrooms were above average. I would definitely return on my next overnight stay or for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: bcaha
Reviews.Content: We chose this Courtyard because we wanted a room with two queen beds and most hotels only offer full size beds. I was concerned about the possibility of noise because of the proximity to the airport. However, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was very quiet, even though we were only on the third floor and over the entrance. The room was dark at night, good for sleeping. The beds were a little on the hard side, which some people might not like. The room and bathroom were both clean. We asked for extra towels and they were quickly provided. We arrived late at night and were able to get a decent meal in the sports bar. There was also a good breakfast there. I also liked the cat in the pool area, very cute. I would stay here again. My son used the gym and said it was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmejia
Reviews.Content: Nice average hotel, went just for one day. Comfortable, clean a bit noisy. Excellent location for business travelers since it's very close to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Place”
Reviews.Author: Xing30west
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly. Very comfortable and clean. A few place to eat at the hotel and in walking distance. Great breakfast place right next door. Make sure you get a Cuban coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: Donovan_Th
Reviews.Content: We spend one night in this hotel waiting for our flight next day. The location is excellent, really convenient to get there from the airport. I was positive surprised with the price level, we got a good deal on the short stay. Everything suited really well for us, room was big enough and we got good night sleep. The bed was specially comfortable. The breakfast started early enough for us to get something to eat before heading out. The breakfast was good and the staff was really friendly even early in the morning. We didn't really had any time to see what else this hotel has to offer (didn't had dinner nor had time to see the leisure activities), but definitely positive experience. I would recommend this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for airport visitors”
Reviews.Author: Julaine
Reviews.Content: We used the Courtyard/Marriott while flying through Miami earlier this month. The hotel was very nice and we felt very secure as there is a gated entry. If I have a criticism, it is that the food and drink prices were terribly high, but I don't go out in cities very much. (We live in a small town.) Two drinks in the bar were $20...dinner at the Marriott next door where we share wine, steak, salad and dessert was over $100. We were able to get a lower room rate $135 plus tax being AARP members.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SBV7
Reviews.Content: Second time I stayed in this Hotel in the last 4 months after the renovation I can tell that this is the best of all Courtyards and and outstanding Hotel/rate/service.. etc.. Congratulations to the Courtyard Miami Airport staff. Good job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay fro Short Business Meeting”
Reviews.Author: mskesq
Reviews.Content: Needed a relatively inexpensive one-night Hotel for a short business trip to Miami. He was coming into Miami Airport and I was coming into Ft. Lauderdale. This was conveniently located close to the airport, with a shuttle for my associate. The room was average size, nothing really big. One king bed in the room, with a large flat screen TV. The bed was comfortable, although the pillows were a bit annoying. Bathroom was acceptable, shower pressure average. You have to pay for parking however. We ate dinner in the restaurant at the Hotel. Food was good. Drinks were excellent. The Hotel was easy to find from the highway. Relatively close to downtown where we had to be in the morning. When I have to return for the next meeting, chances are we sill stay here gain, assuming the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great resturant a Marriott complex.”
Reviews.Author: Earthbound-Traveler
Reviews.Content: There are 3 Marriotts in this compl;ex. Main line, Courtyard and Springhill Suites. The sports bar at the Courtyard is great, the staff makes you feel at home. Not a bad seat in the house to see all the TV's. The bar at the main line Marriott, with Ira as the bartender is a nice cozy spot, spent New Years there. Ira has all the info you need as to where to go, and eat should you venture off the propertry. The good news is not matter what hotel you stay at you can charge to your room, the computers are all interconnected. Pool was nice but the sun dosen't hit it until late in the day. Rooms, very clean and well kept. Found the front desk to be understaffed at times, other than that a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Accommodation”
Reviews.Author: 30_by_thirty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for one night prior to a cruise leaving from the port of Miami. Our package included shuttle service from the airport to the hotel, breakfast, and a transfer to the port on the day of the cruise. The hotel is a quick drive from the airport and the shuttle runs frequently. The hotel staff was pleasant, room comfortable and clean, and the breakfast included in the package was extensive and delicious. The only draw back was the transfer to the port. (It seemed that the transfer was run by an independent company that was contracted through the hotel). Upon check in, we selected one of three transfer times that were offered to us. We chose 11:15. As we were walking to the elevator at a few minutes after 11:00, friends of ours called from the shuttle saying that the driver was leaving since there was no one else in the lobby. Fortunately for us, they were able to tell the driver to wait for us. Since we reserved our time, I expected that the hotel might have informed the driver that not everyone was present. If you book the package including a transfer to the port, just make sure to get downstairs a solid 15 minutes early. Overall, a good choice. The hotel is more economical than staying in downtown Miami but is still close to both the airport and the port.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and very Comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: IntTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here about 8 times on my way to and from Cuba or Colombia. Love the shuttle to and from the airport (very fast and regular service). Breakfast is good and they have excellent fresh fruits, so you can eat healthy. front desk is helpful and they have free computers and internet. Gym is great and not crowded. Best of all the Beds are super comfortable, that a real treat coming back from Cuba...

Reviews.Title: “The CourtYard”
Reviews.Author: Jimmydr
Reviews.Content: I really prefer to stay at a courtyard when possible. They have free internet, free coffee and usually a year round pool that you can use. They have many specials year round.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but horrible customer services”
Reviews.Author: hd248
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms for a one night per cruise stay online with friends and family discount rate. The terms said that we were allowed to book a max. of 2 rooms at this rate. When we got there, the front desk clerk(clerk A) gave us a hard time. She had refused to give us this rate for both rooms and claimed that it was only good for 1 room and wanted to charge us regular rate for the 2nd room. After arguing with her, she had finally gave in. She gave us 2 rooms that were not next to each other. ie. Let say room A & C. When we got there, a very nice cleaning lady had informed us that she had just finished cleaning room B and we should ask for a room change if we want 2 rooms side by side. I immediately called the front desk to have my rooms changed to rooms B & C. Clerk B had answered the phone and had agreed to my request. She asked me to go to the front desk to have my keys exchanged. When I got there, clerk A was there and refuse to make the change and made up a few excuses. I informed her that clerk B had agreed to. She spoke with clerk B, then gave me rooms A & B. I only had the room keys for A with me as I had requested for rooms B & C on the phone. She insisted that I go back to my room to get the keys for room C to return to her and refuse to give me rooms B & C. After arguing with her, she gave in and gave me rooms B & C like I had requested. I gave her the keys for room A to be changed to room B. She gave me keys for room C, which I already had. She did the same thing 2 more times. She had finally got it right the 4th time and gave me the keys for room B. I had thanked her after the whole thing and she did not even respond to me at all. She was very rude eversince I had stepped into the hotel. I had spoken with 2 other clerks and they are also not friendly. I have never been to any hotels with such horrible customer services. I couldn't get anything done without a fight. I have stayed at Marriott a few times and I've liked their hotels and services. This experience will make me think twice about booking with them again in the future. Veryyyyyyy disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Caymanita
Reviews.Content: We booked a short two night stay at the Marriott Courtyard since we were visiting Miami on a Christmas shopping trip from the Caribbean and got a good deal with Cayman Airways, our national airline. We had a less than favorable trip just getting to Miami, and when we arrived at the hotel I was very disappointed. The lady who checked us in was not warm and welcoming, and didnâ€™t even give directions to our hotel room. When we found our room, I was greeted by more disappointment. The room was very stuffy and smelled horrible! I had two packages delivered to the hotel and paid for advance shipping to make sure they got there on time. I asked the front desk to check if it was there, and they came back and said there was only one for me. I thought this was strange as it should have arrived well before me but I didnâ€™t take it further and left it for another day. In the meantime I contacted the seller and asked them to re-send the items. When I came to check out, I asked again about the packages and it was there. A lady brought it over to me and said that she had two packages for me and one had been waiting for me for over a week. I was very frustrated by this since I ended up having to pay for the products twice and could not return the duplicate package since I was going home. Getting a taxi from this hotel is almost impossible. The front desk staff called one for us but on two separate occasions we ended up waiting for almost an hour! The weird thing is when I went for a walk around the complex (there is a Marriott, a Courtyard and Residence Inn in the same complex), I noticed three taxis lined up at the entrance to the complex. Why did it take so long? There was meant to be free Wi-Fi but we were never able to log on to the Wi-Fi so ended up using one of the three computers in the lobby. The level of service I would expect from a Marriott branded hotel was not there. I travel to Miami often and always stay at an airport hotel, sadly this is one I will not return too.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, great and convenient hotel with spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mot-de-pass
Reviews.Content: Flying in to Miami for a night from the Caribbean, I needed to find a room in a quiet and comfortable hotel around Miami International Airport as I was flying out the next day around 10am to Europe. I got a good deal at Courtyard By Marriott Miami Airport South and I didnâ€™t hesitate a second to book a room there. I believe it was in part because I had stayed there in the past, had a great experience, but I never really had a chance to write a review. Out of the Terminal, I waited for about 7 min for the hotel shuttle bus which I easily recognized. The hotel being just about a mile away from MIA, I barely had time to sit that we were already pulling into the complex where 2 or more others hotels from the Marriott family are located. And just as I was expecting it, I quickly recognized the friendly and warm welcome at the front desk. The check-in was fast and efficient, and I was in my room in no time. The room looked spacious, clean and well decorated. There was a nice sofa next to the bed, though I didnâ€™t really need it, it added a charm in the room. I had a king size bed just like I requested and was happy with it. The bathroom was also clean and spacious with a tub and a huge mirror. I had a very quiet night and woke up refreshed! Additionally, and itâ€™s one of the things that I really appreciated in this hotel, I had ordered few stuff online to be delivered at the hotel before even I checked-in, stuff that I wanted to take them with me to Europe. Itâ€™s all went very well; once I identified myself to the security from my room, they had my stuff brought up to my room like an express delivery. The only negative point that I noted was a small leak from the A/C in the room right in front of the bathroom entrance. There was water coming out of the A/C, making the carpet a bit wet, not a major issue but enough to be noticed. Since I was only spending one night and needed just a great night sleep, it didnâ€™t bother me at all as I was totally satisfied with my night. Overall, I had a great experience, just like the previous one, and would definitely go back if I have a chance. I would recommend this hotel for its proximity to Miami International Airport if you are spending a night or if you just want to be far away from the noisy airplanes landing or taking-off, but at the same time be close to the Airport. There are also many restaurants and fast food around the hotel, should you need to go out for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: vpnow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I have stayed there twice in the past month The best part is the way is is set up with Marriott right next door. So you end up with two places to eat right there and there is a Starbucks in the lobby of the Marriott. The first time I was there it rained all week but I found a complete covered path back and forth. The review about no places to eat within walking distance is fairly accurate. The coffee place just outside the gate is good and a little further down is Cafe Latino which has a large selection, and the food is good,but it is nothing fancy otherwise it is a short drive to more food. It appears that some parts of the hotel are newer than others it is obvious there are updating rooms and I don't mean construction you can just see the differences. If I have any complaint it is that there are no refrigerators or safes in the room. On my second visit I would have gotten my leftovers to go from the restaurant but with no refrigerator I would not be able to store them. As for the staff they were very helpful. Danny B was beyond helpful when the printer was broken. He made sure my document was not going to print later and then assisted me with printing at the front desk. The only time I had a problem was later in the evening on my first visit I went on a hunt for a soda and they do not have soda machines in the hotel instead they have a small shop by the front desk. I am ok with this however the clerk working was by herself and so busy she did not have the ability to ring me up, I finally left and went back to my room still thirsty. Another hotel employee of unknown position said to just take the drink but he did not appear to have the authority to give that direction so I opted to play it safe. All in all both of my stays were good and quiet. It's very close to the airport and I used the shuttle the first time which was very timely. From the airport there are a couple of Marriott shuttles this one says Marriott Airport South on it. The second stay I had a rental car. This is a gated parking lot and your room key is your parking key. Mine did not work the first time at the gate but they quickly fixed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great one nite”
Reviews.Author: CecilBarrie
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel after our cruise to rest. They took us at 10:00 in the morning an early check in and it went smoothly. The room was very clean and in a quiet area of the hotel. Their hotel restaurant had amazing reasonably priced food. We never got a chance to try the pool as it rained all day. That was the only bad thing the weather but they cannot help that. They did have great tv shows to keep us entertained. We would not hesitate to use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: NM43
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quiet and comfortable. The (free) airport shuttle is quick and efficient. The internet speed was ok for me on October 3-4 but quite sluggish on October 12. I would hesitate to stay there again because of the sluggish experience. The restaurant situation isn't the greatest. You can easily walk over to the Marriott and eat in a slightly better restaurant than the one at the Courtyard, but it's overpriced and nothing to get excited about. If you want a sandwich, there's a good Cuban sandwich place just outside the gates of the Marriott complex (Sabor Latino), but there's not much of anything within walking distance for a good dinner. (Minor point: Why do Marriotts put the hair-dryer in a bag in the closet? They apparently think that's somehow classy. I find it inconvenient.)

Reviews.Title: “Nice memories”
Reviews.Author: Huntraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for two weeks (earlier than 2010, but I couldn't set up that date). Carnival Cruise Lines had booked a room for me. It was a very pleasant stay. The location was fine, very close to the airport and a shopping mall. It is easy to get into the downtown or the Miami Beach even by public transportation, but it takes around 45 minutes. It is close to the Little Habana. The pool and gym was very good. The restaurant is nice and the staff were kind. I can recommend the Chicken Cajun Fusilli, who loves spicy food, but also the BBQ chicken wings were nice. The weather is hot, good for going to the beach. From the pool you can see the tv screen of the gym, so I could watch the world cup soccer matches from the pool. It is a great place I got a lot of nice experiences and memories here.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what you need: near airport/short stay between flights”
Reviews.Author: Murchelon
Reviews.Content: It was a nice hotel. Clean, near the airport and witha great staff. The rooms were ..normal bt well organized and clean. I requested to change room because I was at the 1st floor .. with window in front of the parking lot and they did it very fast Nice pool, kind of small but I wasnt expecting a resort, due to the price. They have the flights times and schedule in a big TV on the front desk. It was very nice. I would stay again and i would recomend to a friend. Cons: Dont have anything near. have to go by car to buy a something

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Trey1096
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights for business. Very convenient to the airport. Not the newest facility in the area, but it was well kept. Two good restaurants are on the property with a couple more within easy walking distance. Like most Courtyards, there was no option for a refrigerator in the room. The only detraction I noticed was that you had planes taking off regularly, but it wasnâ€™t terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Naphiyl
Reviews.Content: From my check to my shuttle to the airport everything was above expectations. It does not hurt that there is a great sports bar/restaurant off the lobby and Starbucks on premises. Nor does it hurt that the front desk was performed all the services of a concierge. The property is fresh and up to date. The service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, better stay at the Residence Inn within the same campus”
Reviews.Author: Luz1980
Reviews.Content: IÂ´ve stayed on the Marriot Miami Airport South campus before, and the Residence Inn is THE BEST place to stay in Miami for a long period of time. Unfortunately, the Courtyard is not as good. The front desk staff is courteous and the rooms are nice and comfortable. Unfortunately, the property is terribly noisy (there wasnÂ´t a single night when I wasnÂ´t woken up either by noisy room neighbors (REALLY noisy) or by people on the corridors (guess walls and doors are made our of cardboard). One night I was even woken by the smell of heavy cigarette smoke in my room, coming from the bathroom vent. Why was I even advised it was a non smoking hotel, if when I call the front desk to complain IÂ´m solely told "IÂ´ll let the manager know" (???). Another separate issue is housekeeping in this property. tÂ´s terrible. Worst IÂ´ve ever experienced. On the first week of my stay, they took a shirt I was sleeping in with the linens. And IÂ´m not talking of a white shirt. It had different colors so it would have been clearly visible on my bed if there had been careful housekeeping. But the worst part is that I asked the front desk to have someone look in the linens chute or ask the cleaning company to look for it and never heard back. One day, coming back in the hotel, I asked them if there had been any news. My complaint was not even there, it had never been filed. Of course, by that time it was too late to look, so they asked their "operations manager", and the next day they left me a voicemail saying they hadnÂ´t found anything. Of course. So, I lost my shirt and nobody even offered to compensate in ANY way. But the housekeeping chapter doesnÂ´t end here. They NEVER, not one single day, clean inside the shower (and God knows about the rest of the bathroom). I was leaving little empty conditioner bottles in there, to see if they at some point cleaned them up, and when it got up to 4, i threw them out myself because it made me sick to thing they werenÂ´t not only not cleaning, but also not even looking at the shower, because you could clearly see the empty bottles and old soap through its glass. They never changed the soap, and rarely vacuum cleaned the room. Some of the sheets had stains and the blanket had holes. If a piece of paper fell on the floor next to the desk, it could be left there for days (I started leaving these kind of small tests behind to see if they were cleaning at all). One day they didnÂ´t even leave towels in the bathroom, so I had to get dressed when I got back at about 10 pm and was about to jump in the shower, to call the front desk and have toweld be brought up to my room. When I did, they even asked me how many I needed (just the ones housekeeping should have left in my room!!!). Good for short stays, not so good for long business stays when you need to get good rest and exceptional service. And my shirt never came back home with me.

Reviews.Title: “Staff...non-existing!”
Reviews.Author: Cav0903
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for one night, though a very nice location, the staff was noticeably non-existant. Ready for bed, adjoining room guests decided to smoke in the room. The strong odor was unbearable and the front desk staff was not able to do anything other than spray a bit of air freshner. No sleep that night. At 4am...the smoker decided it was time to light up again. Strong smell woke me up again. Called front desk. "sorry sir, there is nothing we can do other than check the room at THEIR departure". OK! How about me? The staff did nothing to correct the problem. My first stay at Marriot and surely my last.

Reviews.Title: “New, spacious, friendly staff, very close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: SolymarBQ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new. The staff was friendly and efficient. There is a free shuttle to the airport that comes every 15 minutes. Several restaurants in the hotel complex as well as walking distance from the hotel. Spacious, clean, nice and comfortable rooms. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport overnight Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveller147388
Reviews.Content: If you need to overnight close to the Miami Airport, this hotel is a good choice. Very close to the airport, reliable shuttle, clean functional rooms, excellent gym, good eating choices as it is part of the 4 hotels in the Marriott compound. However I would not really recommend for more than a couple nights. The hotel is mainly used for guests catching flights. As a result it gets quite noisy with the sounds of doors closing and suitcases moving very early in the morning and quite late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: markbenn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Courtyard by Marriott and Miami Airport for one night on a flight lay over. We were walked to this hotel by another property where we had a reservation. The other hotel took little concern that it was 1:30 am and I was traveling with my family of six. The desk clerk at the Courtyard was very kind and understanding. Made sure that we had three rooms because they only had king rooms left. (The other hotel complained about that!) Check-in was very quick. We were in our rooms in less than five minutes. Rooms were nicely furnished, well maintained and beds were comfortable. We ate breakfast in the hotel the next morning. A little pricey, especially when it was included with the original hotel we had booked. ($106.00 for the six of us, buffett) Shuttle back to the airport was very prompt. I would definitely stay here again on a similar layover.

Reviews.Title: “happy family group”
Reviews.Author: marilyn j
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST HOTEL that we ever stay we loved it and we,ll be back by december

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: NortonG
Reviews.Content: Clean and staff were wonderful. Ate at bar/restaurant and it was terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bajan4
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel near the airport, look no further! The Courtyard has everything to offer. It is on the Marriott compound. The Courtyard has a sports bar which has a good selection on the menu and the service is timely. The breakfast buffet also will satisfy everyone needs with eggs, bacon, sausages, cereal, pastries, waffles, beagles and fresh fruit. You can also eat the the Canfire restaurant at the Marriott. If you have time on your hands you can use the gym, which is well equipped, or you can relax around the pool. The pool is shared with the other two hotels on the compound. Free internet is a plus. This trip I have a very early check-in, 8:00am. The was no issues with checking in so early. Although I am not handicap, was was assigned a handicap room. The room was large. The bed was very comfortable and unlike most hotels there were plenty of pillows. The bathroom, in my opinion, had everything needed for a handicap person. The tub was fitted with a number of railings all around the tub and also a pull down seat. The shower head could be detacted if it needed to be. Railing are also by the toilet. The staff were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Stay too short”
Reviews.Author: MikeyK
Reviews.Content: We overnighted at the Courtyard before our return trip home via New York so the stay was very short. I was impressed with the overall Marriott campus as well as the hotel itself. The shuttle service to the airport was great. Check in and out was absolutely painless - well done Courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern courtyard”
Reviews.Author: Steve4031
Reviews.Content: Check inn was efficient and friendly. Room was excellent. Very clean and comfortable. AC worked well on a hot day. Bathroom has solid fixtures. Shower only. I liked this. If you want a tub call and check. Overall an excellent experience. This hotel is also convent for Amtrak. 15 minutes and 15 dollars from station to hotel

Reviews.Title: “Underated. Better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: csmorgan
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, clean and appealing. Bathroom was a litlle on the small side but all amenities were there. Free wired internet and coffee maker. No minifridge. The room was very quiet and with plenty of space. I wouldn't hessitate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as great the 2nd time around”
Reviews.Author: jef7373
Reviews.Content: This was my second time at the Courtyard Marriott Airport South. First was a post cruise stay in Oct 10. This was a pre cruise stay the first part of May 11. After a redeye flight from Seattle I arrived at the hotel around 9AM and checked in with the very friendly staff and the room was ready for me. What a relief after not sleeping all night. The rooms are always fresh and comfy. Champions Bar/Restaurant is great. This is my goto hotel for my trips/cruises thru Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo S
Reviews.Content: I would stay again next time that I have a stop over in Miami. Free parking with easy access. A little noisy location, but nothing that can disturb your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: glennVeroBeach_FL
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of the country and wanted a reasonably priced hotel which was convenient to MIA. We stayed one night and used the hotel's shuttle service to the airport on the morning of our departure. Hotel was quiet, clean and staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we are going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: thebonavitas
Reviews.Content: We went to this Marriott for our kids spring break,nothing too fancy...just to do something!When we check hotels in Miami, prices by Miami beach were terribly high so we decided to stay at this MArriott: the place has been renovated so everything is brand new and you can tell: very clean, lots of computers in the business center,nice big pool,nice rooms and even if is right by the airport, you can't really hear planes at all! Beds are still a queen size, which is harder and harder to find anymore and we travel with 3 little kids and we still fit in there without having to get a second room. The location is also great: is right on S.R. so you can litterally hop on and get everywhere you need to go without any local traffic.Mc.Donald and other fast foods are right around there. We are going back in two weeks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice lobby, room was okay”
Reviews.Author: Amberlina
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night with my boyfriend last weekend. We selected it based on its close proximity to a 2-day seminar we were attending in Coral Gables. It's right off of the main highway, and located on the same property with two other Marriott brand hotels (I think!). The lobby and downstairs area was gorgeous - modern decor with large flat screen tv's playing, lots of seating, and computer stations with large, sleek monitors and free wi-fi. Danny at the front desk was great. The first room we got was on the second floor, right next to the elevator. It had a loud humming noise and the whole room was vibrating. There was no way we would have been able to sleep with that, so I called down & Danny gave us another room with no problem. This one was on the 3rd floor at the end of the hall by the stairway. It was much better in that it was quiet, but here's a few things I didn't like about it: - There was no fan in the bathroom, so the steam just stayed in there after taking a shower. - The friggin bathroom door automatically closes by itself and has no doorstop, so I had to prop it open with the clothes drying rack thing I found in the closet in order to air it out. - The water didn't drain well during my shower, so I was standing in an ankle-deep puddle the whole time. - The room had no mini-fridge. - I'm sure many people like a firm mattress, but for me it was too firm. I no likey! - The hotel IS close to the airport, so we did hear some planes, but honestly they weren't bothersome. On an up note, the room was decorated nicely and it had a large, flat screen tv with Direct TV. Other than that, we wanted to call & order take out from the restaurant downstairs (I think it's called Champions Sports Bar). However, there was no menu in the room (HEL-LO?!), so we went downstairs to place our order and then waited in the lobby area. As I said before, it's very nice, but the AC had to be set at like 50 degrees because we were FREEZING! All in all, it was fine for that one night, but I probably wouldn't stay there again. P.S. Parking is $15 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Miami”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller10
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Very modern and rich feeling. Rooms were very quiet and heard no planes. The rooms were clean and spacious. The restaurant on site was excellent. It is a little away from shopping etc, but has shuttles running to the main sites, except the Port of Miami; we were going on a cruise. The rooms were quite and beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: Yvonsunsch
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed one night at the hotel before catching a cruise. We had chosen it based on the reviews on trip advisor. We caught the hotel shuttle at the airport. The young man at the front desk was warm and informative. We had obtained the room before the prices had risen and was afraid that it would be a dump. We were more than pleased. Breakfast the next morning was good with a nice buffet which was included. The waitress was very friendly. The restaurant was spotless. The Special also included them taking us to the ship. It was a great value. The hotel had been recently renovated and was being maintained. The Marriott and the Residence Inn is also on the hotel campus. The grounds were beautifully groomed. We used the gym at the hotel and it was very nice! It was a great beginning to our cruise. The pictures did reflected the property. If we come back to Miami, I would stay here again. Their staff from the shuttle driver at the airport to shuttle driver to the port were helpful and friendly. First time I used trip advisor to book a hotel, I was more than pleased. I am a nurse and I know how hard it is to please everyone. I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “One to beat in Miami”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: With the exception of the overpriced bar/restaurant on site and the very slow & crowded elevators, our pre-cruise, one- night stay @ Courtyard by Marriott Miami Airport South was excellent. Clean, well-maintained grounds, lots of amenities, bustling & friendly lobby, beautiful pool area. Danny @ front desk was extremely cordial and professional; a real pleasure. Cuban and other restaurants nearby. Lots of plane traffic but still ok.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Earthling911
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a night between arriving on a flight and going on a cruise the next day. We booked it a long time in advance on points. It was a great stay, and the best airport hotel that we have stayed at. We had great service, some hotels seem look down on people who pay with points, the staff at the Courtyard by Marriott Miami Airport South treated us like gold. The restaurant was great, totally understanding that we weren't even close to adjusted to the time zone. The staff at the front desk went above and beyond to help us out. The free shuttle was handy, and we really appreciated the free wireless. The room was great, we didn't hear the planes, and the bathroom was well thought out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services, rooms OK”
Reviews.Author: gemdomer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights on a business trip. I normally stay at the Hyatt Regency downtown near my office but all the hotels on Brickell were full this week so the Courtyard was an economical option somewhat near the office. The hotel is definitely set up for the business traveler - free coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7, free wireless internet throughout the hotel, newspapers, even a copy machine. There is a convenient "flight information" screen in the lobby with updates on flight status at MIA. A surprisingly nice fitness room that is open 24 hours a day. The free shuttle to/from MIA is a big plus. The service is very friendly and it was probably the fastest check-in of my life - literally less than one minute! The buffet breakfast is basic but good, although it's not free like in some other hotels near the airport. My colleague and I were able to get a taxi right outside the hotel with no problem. The rooms were updated and nice, although basic. No plush towels or fluffy bed covers. The beds were quite firm and the pillows small. It was a little chilly while I was there and I ended up grabbing the covers off the other bed and piling them up on mine, and felt fine with that. I did see a couple of hairs that definitely weren't mine on the floor. The shower had extremely strong pressure. I did not hear any noise from the airport but did hear a little bit of noise from my neighbors (their TV, coughing, using the bathroom) but nothing that would keep me up at night. Overall I would recommend this hotel as extremely functional and modern. It's great for the business traveler or someone passing through who just wants to eat, sleep, get online, maybe get a workout. Nothing fancy, but it gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: kenkar_TO
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Courtyard Marriott the night before a cruise. I was pleasantly surprised about the cleanliness and the look of the room. I had a comfotable rest that night and found the staff to be friendIy. I would definitely stay at this hotel again next time I'm in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: teddy6617
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before a cruise. I booked it based on the Marriott name. When we first pulled up, we both thought "Oh no, old hotel, not in a great location, not going to be a restful night". Well, you can't judge a book by its cover. We walked thru the front door and it was like walking into a 4 star hotel. They have evidently spent a small fortune redoing the whole inside...including the rooms which were clean, newly done, spacious and the beds were very, very comfortable. We were not impressed with the restaurant...poorly run, breakfast buffet was nothing spectacular...but the rest was great. It shares the same location with a regular Marriott so their was a shared pool, fitness center..brand new with up to date machines...and a shared courtyard that was very nice and had plenty of chairs/chaise lounges to relax in. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service, good rates, and no noice problem!”
Reviews.Author: PerBCA
Reviews.Content: We were two families with a baby and three teenagers staying at the Courtyard by Marriott Miami Airport South on Christmas Day for one night before our cruise. I booked the hotel based on reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were all very pleased. The service from we arrived late at night until we left was excellent, better than I have experienced at many higher-end hotels. The rooms are very nice, comparable to most higher-end hotels. The sports bar had good food. I didn't try to fitness center or the pool, but they looked fine. My biggest concern with a hotel that close to an airport was the noise level. We had two rooms in our group - one facing the airport and one facing the freeway. We did not hear any noice in either room. Some people in our group are very light sleepers and they were all impressed with the sound insulation and lack of noice. This Courtyard is located right next to the Marriott and the Residence Inn by Marriott, providing some more options for restaurants and bars within a minute walking distance. I highly recommend this hotel if you need a comfortable and reasonably priced hotel for a short stay or for business. If you want to stay longer and explore Miami you probably want to find a hotel in a more interesting location. If you are flying in late in the day and need a place to stay before your cruise this is the perfect place. They offer shuttle to the port for $11 per person, as well as taxi etc.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Airport and Miami Beach”
Reviews.Author: chriskuo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Miami airport late at night and did not want to pay Miami Beach prices for a short night. We took a convenient free shuttle to the Marriott campus very near the airport. The campus also has a Marriott and a Residence Inn. The Courtyard is a medium-rise as well. The restaurant has a full service restaurant / sports bar and you can take advantage of the Marriott as well. It was about a $30 cab ride to Miami Beach the next day. Many cruise ship passengers were also staying there. All in all, it met our needs very well.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: JM11traveler
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed here at this Courtyard by the Airport for two nights and it was very nice. The hotel is in whats called the "Miami Marriott Airport Campus" where there is a full service Marriott, Residence Inn and a Fairfield Inn next door. The Courtyard is old but they recently added another section and renovated the whole hotel. It looks brand new. I was in the new section and the room was super clean and modern. The staff that checked me in were very friendly. There was a really nice sports bar in the lobby but we did not eat there. The beds in the room were firm but sleep-able. If you need a place to stay close to the airport, I'd highly recommend staying at the Miami Airport Marriott Campus Hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Can't they throw in a breakfast?”
Reviews.Author: nlcourt
Reviews.Content: For what this place costs you would think that breakfast would be free. We were in a rush to get to the airport and had to quickly eat something and went to the buffet there at hotel. Everything was tasteless and cold which doesn't bother you if is free, but for what it costs, it should be good. Next time we will pick a hotel that has breakfast included.probably will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but could use some improvement”
Reviews.Author: AR1900
Reviews.Content: I'm still struggling about whether I like this or not. I stay exclusively at Marriotts and travel frequently so I feel I am a good judge of it. First the good: 1) I was concerned about airplane noise keeping the kids awake because we are right next to the runway. However, it was not a concern at all. Windows are well insulated and even though the planes fly right by the building, you can't hear them at all. Thus sleep concerns are not an issue. 2) We had a 1-bedroom suite. It was fine, the kitchen was nice actually. Clean and all modern equipment (fridge, stove, dishwasher, etc.). Nice marble counter tops. Very nice look too. 3) good for family The improvement portion: 1) room service must skip the even numbered rooms cause they never stopped by our room to clean anything, though they did adjacent rooms. Could have been just an oversight - mistakes happen, no big deal. 2) front desk personnel were kind of off - one was grumpy, the other one did not conduct herself to the level of professionalism I have come to expect from Marriott. I'm not asking to have my feet kissed or anything, but a little professional courtesy would be nice. If Bill Marriott came in, he'd probably would have fired them on the spot. 3) the room was obviously cleaned, but there was long black hair everywhere, possibly by the cleaning person. Kinda nasty. All in all, I would still recommend it. The building is clean and modern, close to airport and right off the express way to downtown/Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: martyj49
Reviews.Content: Good hotel free pickup at airport nice rooms. Booked hotel pre cruise with shuttle to cruise port and breakfast. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for great price”
Reviews.Author: Dora C
Reviews.Content: Upgraded to the "Pure" room when I arrived (was $20 extra/night, but included $15 for parking, so really just a $5 upgrade) and got a spacious clean room. Not sure if there's any benefit to the "Pure" room, but apparently they are supposed to be cleaner and come with air purifier and proper mattress covers. Free internet, great exercise room and service was good. Had dinner at the Champions restaurant in the lobby, which was not great, but as expected for a hotel lobby restaurant. Location was close to airport and they have a shuttle which comes fairly often (though, I didn't use it as I had a car). Would definitely recommend that others stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Still great, but the beds are not so much”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed for a night before heading to the beach. We loved this hotel last year and only have one complaint this time around - the beds in our room were hard as a rock! Not what expect from any brands in the Marriott family. Otherwise, polite and knowledgeable staff, great furnishings, free airport shuttle. Hardly any airport noise in the rooms. $25 dollar taxi ride to South Beach. I really hope they get the soft and comfy Marriott beds back for our next stay! Have a great time in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Easy Access to All Areas”
Reviews.Author: jkfoster713
Reviews.Content: I have been very pleased with the employees and the rooms. The employees have been pleasant and the rooms very clean. My sister and I stayed here becuase it has a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel and vice versa. You can also purchase shuttle service for $11 to the Port of Miami. There is a public transit bus #7 about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel that you can get on for 2 dollars one way. It can take you east to downtown Miami or west to Dolphin Mall. We came in 3 days before our cruise and had lots to do and see. The free wi-fi wasn't great because we kept losing its signal.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, comfortable hotel but area neighborhood was a bit run down.”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night before a cruise and one night upon return of the cruise. There are three hotels sitting on the same property which share one pool. The Courtyard hotel offered a nice sports bar restaurant with decent prices. There is a modern fitness room which is larger than most I have ever seen at a hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The business center and free internet was a bonus. There is a shopping center and fast food restaurants within 20 minutes walking distance. Even though the area is a bit run down and I was a bit concerned for the safety of my family, nobody bothered us when we made this walk. It cost us a flat 24 dollars to get us to the cruise port via taxi. The hotel also offers a private shuttle service to the port for $10 a head. All in all, it was a good experience for the price. I felt the hotel offered much for the price. One more thing, the rooms they offer don't have a microwave or refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “much improved remodeled hotel but disappointed in a few things”
Reviews.Author: stevecwood
Reviews.Content: I'm a frequent patron of Marriott Hotels and gave my rewards number to the desk clerk. I expected the customary upgrade but when I got to the room 4225 I discovered the view was a great view of the air conditioning system on the adjacent roof. I was also disappointed in "the market" which does not have price tags on their sundries. When I got the reciept, I saw that a half bottle of run of the mill red wine was $15. a small box of crackers was $5. Now I know why items do not have price tags. Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff/ Beautiful Rooms/ State of the Art Gym”
Reviews.Author: celesteskycop
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the MIA Courtyard Marriott Airport South because we needed a place to stay the night before our cruise. I chose this hotel because it had a complimentary airport shuttle that ran until 1am (my boyfriend's flight was landing around midnight and the other hotels' shuttles didn't run that late. My red eye flight from San Francisco however landed around 8 am ( 7 hours before check in). I called the hotel and asked where to meet the shuttle. Danny at the front desk was so patient and helpful as I tried to navigate the large airport looking for where the hotel shuttles picked up. Even though check in wasn't until 3pm, I took the shuttle over early, intending to ask the front desk to hold my bags until check in time. Danny at the front desk saw how tired I was and said since my room was ready I could go up early! The room was beautiful! Good quality bedding and free internet . One of the best things about htis property was that the gym had cold bottled water, complimentary apples, and every piece of cardio equipment had an individual tv on it so my boyfriend and I could watch our separate shows while still working out together. Danny also helped me arrange economical transportaion to the Port of Miami to get on our cruise. He made reservations with a tranportation company to get us there for only $11 each. He was so knowlegeable and friendly. He told me how to take the free airport shuttle to MIA, get on a public bus over to south beach for $2 each way. I was able to go enjoy the beach while I was waiting for my boyfriend's flight to land later that night. This hotel and staff were so nice that we decided to stay there again after our cruise. Champions Sports Bar in the lobby also has happy hour where you can get drinks and fabulous onion rings (I recommend with the horseradish dipping sauce) half price!

Reviews.Title: “Pefect stay”
Reviews.Author: n20093
Reviews.Content: Everything was pretty well, as I rated. Service was good, very close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good service”
Reviews.Author: Pacific27
Reviews.Content: Clean, nicely appointed rooms. Friendly and helpful staff. It was a nice welcome to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller-Bajan
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for an overnight stay and was very pleased with the service we received and the quality of the room. There was also the airport shuttle which was handy for us. You can also catch the shuttle bus to the mall at the Marriott next door. It is well worth the stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Miami es bonita”
Reviews.Author: shaney_jr
Reviews.Content: What a way to welcome you to Miami... it was pouring with rain and it was humid and I just came off an 8 hour flight and got interrogated by customs lol but it was worth the wait after I checked in for the first night at Marriott courtyard Miami nr airport. I had my bags taken to my room by some guy called Juan, humble didn't even want a tip. Clean spacious rooms and the cleaner was hard working. Bar is great, got a long island ice tea in Miami lol, Great internet and business facilities and also a lovely big pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: soi012
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel ater reading the positive reviews and we made an excellent choice. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. The lobby is great, it has several computers with internet for the guests. Plus there is three separate areas with comfortable sofas and tv's aside from a big plasma tv in the middle of the lobby. We had our kids runnings and playing inthe lobby area while my husband watch ESPN (unable to do it n the room with only one tv). I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: anabella90210
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Room was very clean, spacious and quiet. Shower and bed were awesome. TV had lots of channels, HBO among them. Internet (wireless and wired) is free in your room. There is also a business center, useful if you need to print your boarding pass or check your email if didn't bring your laptop. The lounge area is nice and they offer coffee for free from 5:00am till 10:00am and if I can recall 5:00pm till 8:00pm. They have a fitness center as well. Despite being close to the airport, this hotel is very quiet, there are not low flying planes over the hotel all the time, on the other hand went to a Walmart in Miami from where you could hear and see planes over your head every 5 minutes or so (I got to take good pictures of these low flying planes from here). I didn't use the shuttle bus, but I saw it coming and going. I rented a car (parking is not free I was charged $15/night for parking). On another note about the room, there was a coffee maker in the room, and upon request I got a mini fridge which I loved. There was an ice machine next to the elevators. The bathroom was very clean as well. The only downside in my opinion is the quality and quantity of the shampoo and conditioner and they don't provide bathrobes, nor hand or body lotion. I stayed there for 4 days/nights I overall I enjoyed my stay there, I chose that area because I rented a car and didn't want to pay the higher rates of the hotels near the beach, as I could come and go, and enjoy Miami the same. I'm quite happy and I certainly recommend this hotel to everybody (unless you travel with your pet, this hotel won't allow pets). Everything else including staff (agents at front desk and housekeeping) was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I booked 3 rooms through priceline ($50...”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaJewel
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms through priceline ($50) . The hotel was Beautiful & modern, clean and the staff was friendly. It was nice having a restuarant in the hotel lobby, we were all tired and didn't feel like going out. The sandwiches were good. The business center was state of the art, huge screens, free internet in the room, wireless free. Crib free. Hotel staff set up crib and helped me get ice when my hands were full with the baby Nothing bad about the stay . I will definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Clean simple business hotel”
Reviews.Author: wellswells74
Reviews.Content: It was very functional for my short business trip. clean (a priority for me) service was good enough, but not great not alot of frills, but you get what you pay for

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful new hotel with new design”
Reviews.Author: MAB82
Reviews.Content: Due to an unfortunate delay at Miami Airport, we needed a room close to the airport and easily booked a room at the Courtyard Airport South. We were pleasantly surprised by the new hotel design and newer amenities. I've stayed in many Courtyard locations....most with an older style....but this had a full bar, and restaurant, contemporary decor, and easy shuttle access to the airport. (no more than 5 minutes). The rooms appear to be larger, and the beds are quite comfortable. I'm glad to see Marriott moving this direction with the Courtyard brand.

Reviews.Title: “Great Overnight Airport Stay”
Reviews.Author: caftan1874
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on the hotel from Priceline, but I was a little scared when I pulled up to the hotel in the shuttle. The outside isn't in bad condition, but has obviously aged. Inside everything has been redone and it really looks great. The staff was very nice and really helpful. There are two hotels back to back with a very nice swimming area in between. There is a Starbucks in the adjacent hotel (your room key will allow you entry) and two restaurants in the hotels. The internet in the rooms is free and also in the lobby I believe. I wish there were a fridge in the room, but no big deal. There is a Latino restaurant by the road, gas station, and a Miami Subs (wouldn't recommend) within walking distance. There isn't much in the area, it just seemed like a decent hotel to be in that's close to the airport. Also, depending on the side of the hotel your room is on, planes do pass over frequently and can be a little loud. Overall, I was pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for overnight MIA connections”
Reviews.Author: Roombaguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night due to an overnight connection at MIA. I booked this online and must say I was very pleased ; no complaints at all. The room seemed very new/renovated and had all the comfort I would expect of a Marriott hotel. Free WiFi, LCD TV, glass window shower and a very comfortable bed. Even though my flight arrived quite late, I waited at most 10 minutes for the shuttle to arrive. In the morning, the shuttle left the hotel at exactly the time I was told it would. This property is about 5 minutes from the airport, but does not seem to be in the direct path of planes since I was not bothered by noise at all. If I ever have another overnight connection at MIA will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room”
Reviews.Content: The rooms, as the other reviews state, are really nice. Again, no real airport noise. The bar/restaurant area was also a nice touch. I have stayed in many Marriotts but only one other Courtyard. I'm not sure if this one is just really, really nice or if this is par for the course. If you are relying on the shuttle take the one prior to the one you think you should take as the shuttle stops at the two other Marriott properties located right next to it and at one of the stops our driver disappeared into the hotel for 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “If we had a choice...”
Reviews.Author: sugarmtnvt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot due to missing our connecting flight in Miami from Jamaica. We arrived after 10:30 PM and the restaurant remained open for us. Service was great food was deish. I had called ahead and they were all ready for us. Rooms are beautiful and comfortable. We slept awesome. We had just spent a week at Sandals in Ochos Rios and the Marriot was much nicer. We fly through Miami often and have missed our connecting flight before. If it happens again and we have to spend the night I will request the Marriot Courtyard on Lejeune !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, this hotel should be a training hotel for all Marriots!”
Reviews.Author: jumpinjax
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived after our cruise we were treated like royalty. The staff was more than accomodating to help us check-in early. They were super busy but had the most guest friendly lobby. My hubby and I sat in our semi-private lobby area with our own tv and enjoyed a brief lunch when to out surprise we were given our room early. Later that evening, we wanted to go to dinner in South Beach and the staff had a large number of suggestions. We enjoyed stone crabs and lobster at Joe's. Best dinner. The next day we were to fly out to Baltimore at 9:25pm. Check-out was at 1pm. They allowed us to store our luggage and we went to the Dolphin Mall for a few hours. We came back and the staff was perfectly welcoming though we had checked out. Awesome staff. Best hotel service we have had in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice”
Reviews.Author: MoondoggieA1A
Reviews.Content: Very nice property - clean, updated Courtyard with an excellent, helpful staff. It is only a very short walk to the Marriott so you have access to their restaurant as well as the sports lounge at the Courtyard. Good solid airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great rates”
Reviews.Author: westbrooksc
Reviews.Content: We came to stay at this hotel after a terrible night at the Fairfield Inn MIA West. What a transformation! The hotel was a very nice business class hotel. The free wi-fi in the public areas was really appreciated and provided a great working space. The sports bar is beautiful. A great and comfortable place to hang out and watch a good game. The hotel staff were pleasant and very accomodating. They kept placing us in rooms which were already occupied and were extremely apologetic, though we were quite understanding as it was superbowl weekend and many guests decided to stay rather than check-out as planned. The manager was not happy about this and upgraded our room to an alergy free room and provided us with free snacks. The room and bathrooms were clean, nicely decorated and very large. We had a great view of the city skyline and golf course on the 10th floor. The bathroom was quite spacious for a hotel bathroom and the shower very nice though the water could be hotter. But that just be me as I like my shower scorching hot. The bed was comfortable, but the pillows were entirely too soft. Other than that everything was great! We really enjoyed our stay and got a great rate at the last minute considering it was Superbowl weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed for about a week over New Year's. I know it is an airport hotel, but for the service and value, I think I'll stay here on future Miami trips. Gorgeous Courtyard rooms with lovely Marriott bedding. Good water pressure in the bathroom. Spotless house keeping. Hardly any noise from the planes. Pay $13 per day for parking. About a 10-15 minute drive to South Beach (we would get there early each morning and had no problem getting street metered parking for the day). Bar food is pretty good and the little convience shop has drinks and snacks. There is even onsite laundry (they give you Tide for free). Massive fitness room and an outdoor pool. Used the airport shuttle. Staff was incredibly nice and helpful. My only complaint is that they need more staff - things got crazy in the lobby at times with massive groups checking in and out. Have a great time in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport, nice room, slow check-in and airport shuttle delayed”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Chiqui
Reviews.Content: The decor and linens in this Courtyard were good, looked similar to a newer Marriott room. This hotel seems new and modern. It is located adjacent to other Marriott chains, with the main Marriott having a great restaurant (we walked over and had fish for dinner). My complaints: - Check-in process was painfully slow after a long international flight. I was behind an airline crew, and there were only 2 employees checking guests in - The shuttle to the airport in the morning was delayed. The number of guests waiting kept growing and people were getting upset. I finally took a taxi to the airport (it was about $10). - ATM was out of cash

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, staff ok”
Reviews.Author: MissouriBeachbunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself are un-fussy travelers and this trip was for shopping/relaxation. The rooms are nicely decorated and all seemed very clean except some hair on the bathroom floor (yuck). But otherwise very clean. Note that all rooms and restaurants/lounges are non-smoking which wouldn't normally bother us but it was very chilly this week and we were on the 3rd floor (no blaconies or opening windows) We decided instead to ask front desk if there were any bar/grills in the area that allowed smoking. Front desk told us usually not. Well, we are aware that most places no longer allow smoking but were hoping she would be able to check or help us especially as the only phone book behind the desk was entirely in Spanish and there was none in the room. All in all, nice place but would have appreciated a bit more effort into customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cran
Reviews.Content: We got a special promotional rate that included free parking. It is southeast of the Miami International airport, and you can hear the planes. Though it did not bother our sleep. The hotel is very new and well decorated. The rooms are large and comfortable. The air conditioning is super quiet, and the elevators are very quick. The area is in a not so great area, but the hotel is on a campus of a full Marriott, a Residence Inn, Courtyard and Fairfield Inn. The lobby includes a touch screen board that is interactive and can help with restaurants, directions and other information. The only minor complaints are: access from the exit ramp from the Expressway going W. does not allow you to make a left turn from a multi-lane busy highway into the driveway, and you have to go one or more blocks around to get to the driveway which is gated and controlled by the room key. There is a lot of traffic during rush hours. The other complaint is the water is not hot enough during the evening when everyone is using hot water. Usually this is a problem in older hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay...nice clean rooms...a great shower!”
Reviews.Author: Kunal_Chadha
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights while visiting Miami. The hotel is very good value for money considering the other over priced hotels available on South Beach...while this is about 20-25 mins away from South beach, since we had a car...we had absolutely no problem accessing the restaurants/night life and the beach on South beach. The rooms are nice/spacious and new. We had a nice king sized bed (good selection of pillows) with a nice big flat screen TV. The bathroom...while not big...was a reasonable size and had a fabulous shower. There is one issue though that the room does not have a refrigerator. Special mention of one of the staff...Danny at the front desk. He was extremely courteous, friendly and very helpful. Made an extra effort to make our stay comfortable. We had an issue with the parking card and he was nice enough to waive the parking charges for us for this. We also had an issue with the room keys...he came rushing himself as soon as he could with some bottled water and a chocolate for us. The staff also allowed us to check out a few hours late.... over all had a very comfortable stay... would certainly return to this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Courtyard if Using Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: This Courtyard has been newly refurbished/rebuilt within the last two to three months. It is absolutely sleek and fresh from top to bottom. We needed to overnight when traveling from Central America to California last week. The hotel is part of what Marriott calls its "campus" of hotels which include a regular Marriott, a Residence Inn, a Fairfield (I believe) and the Courtyard. We paid $120 with tax which we thought was a very reasonable price for such a new and sparkling hotel. There was a Champion's Restaurant on the ground floor which served a great cheeseburger. The check-in team was upbeat and perky. The room was in perfect condition with the exception of the air conditioning system needing some adjustment. We'd stay there in a flash if we need to be in the Miami area again. There is a 20-30minute rotating shuttle service to and from the hotel campus. It would be difficult to find fault with any aspect of this hotel. We booked this room through the Marriott.com web site and chose the senior rate.

Reviews.Title: “NEW and NICE - very impressed. Even ran into J.W. Marriott!”
Reviews.Author: qtpie_ash3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here immediately after the hotel underwent extensive renovations and were very impressed. The decor of the rooms was very updated and modern but still felt comfortable and were extremely well-appointed. The adjacent hotel (Marriott) had several restaurants as well as a Starbucks while the Courtyard has a bar/restaurant that was quite tasty. (I highly recommend the club sandwich!) The bar was trendy and the waitstaff were friendly and efficient. The lobby has a "Smart Board" as seen in recent Marriott commercials which was handy to check the weather or sports scores as we were coming and going. The pool opened just a few hours before we checked it out and it was nice. A tad on the small side (is shared by the Courtyard and the adjacent Marriott) and the jacuzzi looked a bit dingy, but the new landscaping and patio area were extremely well-done and inviting. We also liked the shuttle from the airport and the shuttle to the cruise terminals that were complimenary. The front desk was very courteous and helpful in arranging transportation. We used the fitness facility which was absolutely top-notch; each bike, treadmill, and cross-trainer had their own personal TV's that you could plug your headphones into which made working out much more enjoyable. There was also fresh fruit, water, and towels available. As we were heading out from our stay, we ran into J.W. Marriott along with several of his management team who were quite interested in our thoughts on the hotel, which was a nice surprise! I would recommend this hotel to anyone, without hesitation. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic newly renovated guest rooms”
Reviews.Author: AJ2
Reviews.Content: I I needed a place to stay close to the airport before meeting a friend who was flying into Miami the next day. The Courtyard was fanastic! I booked this particular property because they had a great deal, it was newly renovated and had late-night shuttle running from the airport to the property. The rooms are impeccible - clean and brand-new looking with a modern flare. The workout facility was huge and had great equipment. There is quite a bit of construction close by but I could not hear it indoors. The lobby is also refurbished and the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Pre-cruise stop over”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Never been to Miami before so having the right hotel for the stopover is a must,the courtyard has construction going on but didn't spoil the stay.The service from the front desk was outstanding because we left a bag in the taxi and they tracked it down which was a relief.it has free internet, You need to get a blue taxi not yellow from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient layover”
Reviews.Author: NoOneWillAnswer
Reviews.Content: Stayed for c. twelve hours during a daytime flight layover on Thanksgiving day. So while some facilities were completely shut-down or shared with the Marriott due to the ongoing projects, because of the holiday we were not inconvenienced by any construction noise or disturbance. We got immediate access to the room at 9am, it was fresh and updated with everything in working order, shuttle to and from the airport was prompt. We took the full breakfast buffet at the Marriott, and were pleasantly surprised to find a "construction" discount of 20% on the bill. Staff friendly and competent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: RaCoLo
Reviews.Content: Had 2 stays at this hotel while wating for my flights in and out of Miami. We took a taxi from the airport and arrived at the front desk where we were had an efficient and friendly check in... The hotel is in the middle of renovation as well as the full service Marriott next to it, but as soon as you enter the room you forget all about that. They have just been renovated and the decoration is ecellent very modern, comfortable and clean. It was just what we need for a 12 hour layover and the next day we used the snak area they have in the lobby for breakfast and took the shuttle to the airport which stopped at the Courtyard first and then went to the Marriott to pick up guests. Overall an excellent stay and highly recommended for a short visit to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: ohsheila
Reviews.Content: The Courtyard in Miami Airport South is very nice hotel. Very close to the airport, about 3 - 5 miles. Quiet and very clean, they have a free shuttle to the MIA airport which is very convenient when you are there for a quick business meeting and are leaving soon. The room has flat screen tvs, free internet in the lobby where you can check in online and print your boarding pass.... I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: agkg645
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight to catch an early flight the next day. I found it to be rather over-priced for the accommodations plus you had to pay to park. I think you shouldn't have to pay if you are a registered guest. There is construction going on at these premises so it made it a little confusing to find your way around the property. The room was ok. A little worn but clean. The bedding was fresh and comfortable. Was ok for one night. Maybe I would stay again....maybe not.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: niessuh44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very near the airport, which is constantly under renovation and next to the highway which is noisy. The road signage was not good going to and from the airport. The rooms were somewhat neglected as we left our food tray outside after the first night arrival and they remained there for twenty-four hours. Made us question the F & B standards. Access to the hotal entrance was a problem as we had to lift our baggage up a flight of steps. I would stay in this location again

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night, like you would expect from a courtyard.”
Reviews.Author: JohnT.tn
Reviews.Content: I recently spent one night at the courtyard after driving into town to board a cruise ship the next day. The hotel is located close to the port terminal which was a big plus. I checked in around 1am without trouble. The room was simple, quiet, and clean. There was live music nearby as an entertainment option. I had breakfast in the adjacent Marriott which was very good, with good service. The hotel was pricey, but I guess not unreasonable for Miami in March.

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: PFP
Reviews.Content: Quite worn-down hotel in the Marriott complex. Room was like most older airport hotels, showing many signs of need for a face-lift. We were referred to the adjoining Marriott Hotel for dinner, food very plain. Breakast in the Courtyard in the morning was quite good and included in our room price. All in all a stay which will be easily forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel I've stayed in a long while”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I made this reservation at the last minute and could not do any research. I am American Airlines Platium 2 million miles so I stay in hotels too frequently. As soon as I arrived, I realized this was not going to be a typical Marriott stay. First the front door is a stupid design. What hotel put a stairway at the front door. Arriving with luggage you have to carry it up the stairs! Next there was a person sitting outside the front door that looked undesirable. The check in person was pleasant. The room was worn to say the least. This was not the bad part. There was a extremely strong smell of cleaning solution. So strong I could not breath or sleep. I checked in past midnight and had been traveling for many hours. Did not have the strength to try to change rooms and did not have the belief that any would be and better. I have noticed recently that other hotels are using the same cleaner. I believe they do this to get smoke out of non smoking rooms. The cure is worse than the problem. Breakfast was cold coffee and dry eggs. If you have a choice stay somewhere else or sleep in the park.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: jonesytv
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a bad part of town, however, this is a gated hotel, so when I was in the hotel and on the grounds, I never felt unsafe. My room was clean, appeared to be cleaner than most I've stayed in. My bed is the main issue. These hotels refuse to use fitted sheets, they just use regular sheets. Well the night I arrive, the sheet was too small to be tucked in on either side of the bed. So during the night, it kept coming up and I ended up on that nasty pad. I did tell the front desk about the problem and they told the maids to put a bigger sheet on my bed. After that, I didn't have a issue I was able to tuck the sheet under each side of the bed, however, all hotels should get rid of those non fitted sheets. The food at the hotel was horrible. Don't eat there. Also, the shuttle to the airport does not run 24 hours. If you have an early flight, like I did at 5:30am and you want to take your rental car back the day before to save some time before your flight, you can't do it. The shuttle starts running at 5am and for a 5:30am flight, that's no good. Some of the people working were ok, but most were very rude and did not want to help out.

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Miami Airport South
HotelInfo.Address: 1201 NW LeJeune Rd, Miami, FL 33126
